intro: Jucunda tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly jucunda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
